shower.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a piece of equipment that you stand under to wash your whole body
shower.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Why does the phone always ring when I’m in the shower?
I’d like to use the shower if that’s all right.
The bathroom has a separate shower cubicle  (=a shower in a separate part of the room).
shower.translation[0].definitions[1].def: an act of washing your body while standing under a shower
shower.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Nick rolled out of bed and took a shower.
Mary loves having a hot shower after she’s been swimming.
shower.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a short period of rain or snow
shower.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: More heavy showers are forecast for tonight.
A few wintry showers are likely.
shower.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a lot of small light things falling or going through the air together
shower.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Peter kicked the fire and sent up a shower of sparks.
A shower of leaves fell towards the ground.
shower.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a party at which presents are given to a woman who is going to get married or have a baby
shower.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: We gave a shower for Beth.
shower.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a group of stupid or lazy people
shower.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to wash your whole body while standing under a shower
shower.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to give someone a lot of things
shower.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: She had no children and showered her love on her three nieces.
shower.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to scatter a lot of things onto a person or place, or to be scattered in this way
shower.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The top shelf broke and books showered down.
The ship was showered with hot ash from the volcano.
Hundreds of leaflets were showered over the town.
